result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy F. Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $200 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy F. Kratz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:27 p.m. Defendant Troy F. Kratz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. 16TR777 - DRI. Court orders: 10 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than July 1, 2016, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.   Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Troy F. Kratz
Current: PO Box 14, Unity, WI 54488 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2016)
Prior: 1110 North Ave, Crivitz, WI 54114
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 09:25 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 3:10 PM: Defendant Troy F. Kratz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Charging language of complaint as to typo pointed out by counsel.  ADA agrees.  Court notes concerns and expects matter will be clarified at a later date - does not nullify the complaint however.  NGP received and entered, including TR matter as well.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:25 am.
